Issue a Signed JWT Token

Source: R/helpers.R
issue_token.Rd

Creates and signs a JSON Web Token (JWT) using HMAC with the specified secret. Supports both session-based tokens (identified by a `session_id`) and expiry-based tokens (with an `exp` claim).

Usage

issue_token(
  type = "session",
  secret,
  size = 256,
  header = NULL,
  iss = NULL,
  sub = NULL,
  aud = NULL,
  exp = NULL,
  nbf = NULL,
  iat = Sys.time(),
  jti = NULL,
  session_id = NULL,
  ...
)

Arguments

type

Character string indicating the token type. Either `"session"` (default) or `"expiry"`.

secret

A character or raw vector used as the HMAC secret for signing.

size

Integer, the SHA2 bitsize (256, 384, or 512). Defaults to `256`.

header

Optional named list with additional header fields for the JWT.

iss

(Issuer) Claim, optional.

sub

(Subject) Claim, optional.

aud

(Audience) Claim, optional.

exp

(Expiration Time) Claim, required for `"expiry"` tokens. Should be a POSIXct time or numeric epoch seconds.

nbf

(Not Before) Claim, optional.

iat

(Issued At) Claim, defaults to `Sys.time()`.

jti

(JWT ID) Claim, optional.

session_id

A string identifying the session (required for `"session"` tokens).

...

Additional custom claims to include in the JWT payload.

Value

A signed JWT token (character string).

Details

For session-based tokens, a `session_id` must be provided. The server is responsible for validating that the referenced session is active.

For expiry-based tokens, an `exp` claim must be provided. The token will be automatically rejected by [jose::jwt_decode_hmac()] once expired.

See also

[verify_token()], [jose::jwt_encode_hmac()], [jose::jwt_decode_hmac()]

Examples

library(jose)
#> Loading required package: openssl
#> Linking to: OpenSSL 3.0.13 30 Jan 2024

# Session-based token
tok1 <- issue_token(
  secret = "supersecret",
  sub = "user123",
  session_id = "sess_456"
)

# Expiry-based token (valid for 1 hour)
tok2 <- issue_token(
  type = "expiry",
  secret = "supersecret",
  sub = "user123",
  exp = Sys.time() + 3600
)

# Verification (will fail automatically if expired)
verify_token(tok2, secret = "supersecret")
#> $sub
#> [1] "user123"
#> 
#> $exp
#> [1] 1757850982
#> 
#> $iat
#> [1] 1757847382
#> 
#> $token_type
#> [1] "expiry"
#>
